H0.text: When the Heysel stadium was rebuilt what was it renamed. King Baudouin Stadium

H1.text: When the Heysel stadium was rebuilt what was it renamed. European Stadium

H2.text: When the Heysel stadium was rebuilt what was it renamed. Brussels Arena

H3.text: When the Heysel stadium was rebuilt what was it renamed. Heysell

A4.text: In 1995, a decade after the disaster, the ground was rebuilt at a cost of BEF 1,500 million (around â‚¬37/$50 million in 1995), and at this time renamed the King Baudouin Stadium, after the Belgian monarch who had died two years previously.
